results.title: An American tail
results.brief_description: An animated film about a family of mice who travel from Russia to America to escape their persecution by cats. During their journey, the boy mouse Fievel falls overboard in a wild storm. In his attempts to be reunited with his family, he encounters a range of interesting characters, adventures and close encounters in dangerous and lively New York. When finally it seems he has lost his family forever, it is a friendly cat that finally reunites them. Voices include Dom DeLuise, Madeline Kahn, Nehemiah Persoff and Christopher Plummer.

results.title: An American in Paris
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, United Artists Corporation, Arthur Freed and Vincente Minnelli
results.brief_description: An American in Paris tells the story of an ex-GI art student who has fallen in love with a young French girl and then sadly has been parted from her. At their separation he reflects on his feelings towards Paris - the frustration’s, joys and miseries that have been part of his life and his falling in love. Gene Kelly teams up with Leslie Caron in this spectacularly staged musical featuring songs by George and Ira Gershwin. Academy Award for Best Film 1951.

results.title: An Airplane trip: an instructional sound film
results.brief_description: An instructional film of a plane trip. Dorothy and her mother travel from Los Angeles to salt Lake City. Shows and explains the duties involved in maintaining and servicing such a trip through the mechanics, stewardesses, and pilots and also includes the panoramic views as seen through the eyes of the passengers.

results.title: An Airman remembers: recollections by Sir Gordon Taylor

results.title: An Age of revolutions: USA
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The History of United States foreign relations”.
The first in a series which traces the development of American foreign relations. Presents a history of the United States from before the American War of Independence to the compilation of the Monroe Doctrine in the early nineteenth century. Focuses on America’s first ambassador, Benjamin Franklin, and American relations with the European powers during the War of Independence, the French Revolution and the era of Napoleon, the War of 1812 and the formulation of the Monroe Doctrine.

results.title: An Age of Revolutions. Great Britain
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “An Outline History of Europe”.
Revolution, nationalism, liberty, war, and industrialisation, were the main themes in the history of Europe from 1789 to 1870. This looks at the effects of the two main revolutions in this time, on the whole of Europe. The French Revolution brought new ideas and politics, and the Industrial Revolution brought new wealth and motives, and an urban industrialised society

results.title: An Afternoon with Grigor Piatigorsky
results.brief_description: The life and art of one of this centuries greatest exponents of the cello. He performs the exquisite minuets 1 and 2 from the suite by Johann Sebastian Bach.

results.title: An African community: the Masai
results.creator_credit: BFA Educational Media, Frank Gardonyi and Clifford Janoff
results.brief_description: This film shows how the nomadic Masai live in the highlands of East Africa. It describes their dependence on the land, their adaptation to the environment, and their family and tribal interdependence. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: An Affair to remember [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Jerry Wald and Leo McCarey
results.brief_description: Debonair playboy Nickie Ferrante (Cary Grant) and beautiful nightclub singer Terry McKay (Deborah Kerr) meet travelling first class aboard a transatlantic luxury liner courtesy of two other people. She is a tycoon’s mistress and he is engaged to an heiress. Their sudden, but undeniable love affair leads them to make a vow - that they will break off their current relationships, get jobs and meet in six months to continue their affair. However, a tragic accident prevents Terry from keeping their rendezvous and the lovers future takes an emotional and uncertain turn. This film is a remake of Leo McCarey’s “Love Story” and Vic Damone croons the title tune on the soundtrack.
